nodes.bodyText: If you could fix the spacing so there are spaces before and after the =, !=, ?, : and so forth, that would make this look like the rest of the code.
If you could use some { }'s and indent the while I think this will be good to go.
Nevermind, I see you've changed it around a bit.

This change has some logic errors regarding to the max price. Since the conditional is first thing in the loop, that means that the loop will always be checking the previous iteration's value of next price. This provides the opportunity for the previous iteration's nextprice to be above max price and not be adjusted.
Also resetting the nextprice to maxprice causes some issues as well because it will fail the conditional since nextprice will be equal to maxprice and not greater than maxprice. That means it will take the else branch and force a recalculation which could be greater than the maxprice.
There are quite a few ways to go about fixing this, so it's up to you for whatever approach you want to take. Just make sure to validate that cost will never add a value that is greater than maxprice if it exists.
